snippet: An ad boycott against Rush Limbaugh, the conservative talk show host, is now nearly two weeks old.
abstract: Brian Stelter Advertising column; advertising boycott against Rush Limbaugh continues, two weeks after the conservative talk show host made controversial statements about Georgetown University law student Sandra Fluke on his radio program; evidence shows that the show's syndicator, Premiere Radio Networks, is losing money on the show, but the company has stood by Limbaugh, who has since apologized for the remarks.
lead_paragraph: An ad boycott against Rush Limbaugh, the conservative talk show host, is now nearly two weeks old.

headline.seo: Ad Boycott Dents Limbaugh Show’s Bottom Line
headline.main: After Apology, National Advertisers Are Still Shunning Limbaugh
headline.print_headline: After Apology, National Advertisers Are Still Shunning Limbaugh
